How Do I Rank Bitcoin Bonuses?

To me, the best Bitcoin bonus is not the one with the highest bonus amount or the most free spins.

The best Bitcoin bonus has to give me the best conditions to win the most after clearing the wagering requirements and following the bonus terms.

Regardless of the bonus percentage, amount and free spins, I look at each bonus individually and estimate how much I can win by depositing a certain amount and going through the wagering requirements.

The results are in the list above.

I explain in detail how I find the most promising Bitcoin casino bonus in sections How to choose bonuses and what to watch out for.

But first, let’s look at the different types of bonuses and what they are, so that you will know what to look for (or, you can skip to How to choose bonuses if you have already mastered all bonus types.)

What Is a Bitcoin Casino Bonus

and how does it work?

What is Bitcoin bonus?

A Bitcoin casino bonus is a casino’s promotion, designed to attract new players to try their games and services while potentially winning some money in return.

These are the different bonus types:

  • no deposit bonus,
  • first deposit bonus,
  • second, third, … deposit bonus (as a part of a welcome bonus),
  • reload bonus,
  • free spins,
  • cashback bonus,
  • faucet bonus.

Before I start explaining these bonus types, I have to address the concept of wagering requirement because it concerns all bonuses.

Wagering Requirement

Bonus means that you get something for free to play with. This is either bonus money or free spins which generate you some bonus money.

But this bonus money is not just yours to withdraw and take home. Not right away, at least.

This is where wagering requirement comes in. Wagering requirement is a number (usually between 30 and 50) and tells you how many times you must wager your bonus money before it is yours to withdraw.

For example, if you get 1 BTC of bonus money with a 40x wagering requirement, you must wager 1 BTC 40 times before you can withdraw the bonus money.

As the name suggests, Bitcoin casino no deposit bonus is the only type of bonus that does not require you to make a deposit in order to claim this bonus and play.

A no deposit bonus can be a set amount of bonus money, although it usually comes in form of free spins. By playing these free spins you win an amount of bonus money.

These bonuses look something like this:


There are not nearly as many no deposit bonuses as there are other bonuses. This is because casinos do not like to give out things for free without getting at least something in return first. But a Bitcoin no deposit bonus can be useful because it allows you to try out a casino before you deposit your own money.

Since a Bitcoin casino no deposit bonus usually comes in the form of free spins, it is worth mentioning other free spins bonuses here as well.

Some casinos offer free spins separately from their welcome packages, as a weekly or monthly promotion or even as a one time thing.

Whether they come from a no deposit bonus or not, free spins are the same thing once you get them. The only difference is that no deposit free spins do not require you to make a deposit to get them, while other free spins usually do.

How Do Bitcoin Casino Free Spins Work?

Bitcoin casino free spins are ALWAYS bound to a specific slot(s), which means that you can only use them there.

Unlike regular bets that you make in a slot game, free spins have a fixed bet.

Once you start playing the designated slot, the only thing you can do is spin the reels as many times as you have free spins and hope to have high winnings in the end.

When you run out of free spins, the amount you have won becomes your bonus money.

From this point on, this bonus money acts as any other bonus money; it has to go through the wagering requirement before you can withdraw it.

When you’re playing a slot game, the best possible scenario is to hit that particular symbol pattern that unlocks the bonus feature. Slot game bonus features have much higher multipliers, more free spins and many other opportunities that lead to the biggest wins. If you don’t want to leave getting a bonus feature up to chance, you can always choose to play bonus buy slots, where you can buy to get in the bonus feature immediately! Unfortunately, bonus buy slots usually aren’t the same slots that are used for no deposit free spins, so choose your lesser evil in this case.

Bitcoin Casino No Deposit Bonus Free Spins Exceptions and Terms

  1. Although no deposit bonuses do not require a deposit for you to get the bonus, they still require a deposit before you can withdraw any winnings. This information is too often kept hidden, but it is fair that you know!

  1. Some no deposit bonuses require you to enter a Bitcoin bonus code in order to activate the bonus. If a bonus requires a code, you will find it written next to the bonus in every listing here at Gamblineers.
  2. All bonuses have a maximum allowed bet amount. Although the bet amount is fixed for free spins, it is not fixed for the bonus money that you win – but there is still a maximum bet limit. If you exceed that amount, you lose your bonus money, so be sure to check that before you start playing.
  3. The wagering requirement for free spins actually applies to the bonus money won with free spins. When free spins are a part of a deposit bonus, the wagering requirement can be different for free spins and for the match bonus.
  4. Some free spins are given to you on a daily basis rather than all at once. For example, 100 free spins would be credited by 20 spins a day for 5 consecutive days. The bonus terms will always state that.
  5. Bitcoin casino free spins almost always have a maximum winnings limit. It limits how much of the bonus money you can withdraw, regardless of how much you won after completing the wagering requirements.
  6. Every bonus has an expiration date by which you must use the bonus, or it expires. Bonus expiration date is usually given in a number of days for how long the bonus is valid.
  7. Some bonuses require you to contact the support via live chat in order to activate them; and some bonuses require you to contact the support via live chat to claim only the free spins part of the bonus.

What is a deposit bonus?

Most bonuses need you to make a deposit to get them. They are called ‘deposit’ bonuses.

What is a first deposit?

A first deposit bonus applies only to your first-ever deposit at the casino. This means that you can use the bonus only once, and only the first time you fill your casino account wallet.

A first deposit bonus is also called a sign-up bonus or a registration bonus.

First deposit bonuses look like this:


They consist of a bonus percentage, maximum bonus amount, and (optionally) free spins.

As you make a deposit, the casino ‘matches’ your deposit amount with their bonus money. Hence, a match deposit bonus.

Whether your deposit is matched in full, only partly, or even more than in full depends on the bonus percentage. 100 % doubles your deposit, 50 % results in half of you deposit’s worth in bonus money, 150 % results in 150 % of your deposit’s worth in bonus money, and so on.

If I take the above example and deposit 0.5 BTC, I get 100 % of that in bonus money, so another 0.5 BTC, resulting in 1 BTC altogether which I can use to play.

The maximum bonus amount is the most you can get in bonus money. In the above example, if you deposited 2 BTC, you should get 110 % of your deposit in bonus, so another 2.2 BTC. But since the maximum bonus amount is 1.5 BTC, you only get that much.

Some first deposit bonuses can also include free spins. This is an addition to your main bonus, and in most cases you get free spins even if you deposit only the minimum required amount. Bitcoin casino free spins have their own characteristics and I explain those in the Bitcoin casino free spins chapter.

Free spins are always set to be used on one or a few specific slots; you cannot freely choose where you want to use them.

First Deposit Bonus Exceptions and Terms

I wish that this list could be short, but unfortunately this cannot be the case. Bonuses are promotions and all promotions have dozens of variants and tons of fine print.

But do not let that discourage you; just make sure that you check top terms 3 below so that they do not surprise you later. The rest of the terms and exceptions are more or less nitpicking.

  1. Every first deposit bonus has a minimum deposit requirement. You must deposit at least that much to qualify for the bonus. The minimum deposit requirement is usually written in the bonus terms (If you deposit too little, you wasted your opportunity to get a first deposit bonus. Depositing a second time does not help; deposits do not add up when it comes to bonuses!).
  2. Some first deposit bonuses require you to enter a Bitcoin bonus code to activate the bonus. Some bonuses require you to enter the code before depositing, some as you make the deposit, and some after you make the deposit. Make sure to check, so that you do things in the right order. If a bonus requires a Bitcoin bonus code, you will find it written next to the bonus in every listing here on Gamblineers.
  3. All bonuses have a maximum allowed bet amount question. This limits your bet size when you play with bonus money. If you exceed that amount, you lose your bonus money, so be sure to check that out before you start playing.
  4. Some first deposit bonuses have different wagering requirement for the bonus than they for the free spins. A lot of times the wagering for free spins is higher.
  5. You get some free spins on a daily basis rather than all at once. For example, a casino can give you 100 free spins by crediting 20 spins a day for 5 consecutive days. The bonus terms will always state that.
  6. Some bonuses have a maximum winnings limit. It limits how much bonus money you can withdraw, regardless of how much you won after completing the wagering requirements. However, a maximum winnings limit for the first deposit bonus is uncommon (except for Bitcoin casino free spins!).
  7. Every bonus has an expiration date by which you must use the bonus, or it expires. The expiration date is usually given in a number of days for how long the bonus is valid. It can be different for free spins!
  8. Some bonuses require you to contact the support via live chat in order to activate them; and some bonuses require you to contact the support via live chat to claim only the free spins part of the bonus.

Second, Third, ... Deposit Bonus

as a part of a welcome bonus

You will often see Bitcoin gambling sites advertising their ‘welcome bonus’ instead of a first deposit bonus.

A Bitcoin casino welcome bonus can either be a single bonus or a package of bonuses. A package applies to a number of your first consecutive deposits.

For example, a second deposit bonus of up to 2 BTC + 50 free spins along with a first deposit bonus of up to 1 BTC + 20 free spins can be a welcome bonus of 3 BTC + 70 free spins.

A second, third, … deposit bonus is the same as a first deposit bonus, except that it applies to your second, third, … deposit instead of your first one.

They look like this:

Most casinos do not offer these bonuses, but you can find some that will offer even up to a fifth deposit bonus.

An important thing to remember is that in order to apply for a second deposit bonus, you MUST have used the first deposit bonus first, and must have completed its wagering requirements. The same goes for all further deposits that are a part of the welcome package.

All other bonus exceptions and terms are the same as for the first deposit bonuses.

Reload Bonus and Cashback

RELOAD BONUS

A lot of crypto gambling sites offer bonuses on a regular basis once you become their player. Reload bonuses are one of them.

A reload bonus looks exactly like a first, second, … bonus except it does not apply to your first few deposits at the casino.

Some casinos offer one time only reload bonuses, while others will give them to you monthly, weekly or even daily!

I am going to skip the bonus exceptions and terms here because they are the same as for other deposit bonuses.

The only additional difference is that some casinos will require you to make at least a certain number of deposits before being eligible for a reload bonus.

 

CASHBACK BONUS

Cashback is another ‘regular’ Bitcoin casino bonus offered by many casinos in addition to their welcome packages, reload bonuses and free spins.

I am on the fence about whether cashback should technically be called a bonus, but it is a part of casino promotions and it can still get you bonus money.

Cashbacks do what their name suggests; they get you some cash back. In contrast to deposit bonuses where you get a bonus to play with, cashback means that you get bonus money after you have already played, and depending on whether you lost anything or not.

Cashbacks are usually either daily, weekly or monthly, and can be used repetitively.

You are eligible for cashback only if you have losses while playing games.

The conditions to use a cashback bonus usually take into account your losses over a certain period. If it is a daily cashback then this period is the last 24 hours; if it is a weekly cashback it is either the last 7 days or last Monday to Sunday, and so on.

A cashback bonus is always expressed in percentage and sometimes has an upper limit that tells you the maximum amount of money that you can get back. The percentage applies to your losses.

Although a frequent bonus type in casinos, cashback is not as popular as deposit bonuses, so cashback terms and conditions can vary widely across casinos.

Cashback Exceptions and Terms

  1. Some cashbacks have a set minimum amount. This means that if your losses (calculated by the formula in the cashback terms) do not exceed that amount, you get no cashback.
  2. Some casinos require you to have made a deposit in a certain time period relative to the cashback period in order to be eligible for a cashback bonus.
  3. Some casinos require you to play your entire deposit to zero to be able to use a cashback bonus.
  4. Some cashback bonuses are calculated based on your losses, but the formula for this calculation can vary. The criteria can be that your balance must be lower than your deposit (rarely), it can be losses – (deposit + winnings), or something similar.
  5. Bitcoin bonus code is needed to activate the bonus.
  6. Some cashback bonuses will allow you to withdraw the cashback immediately, but more often than not they will come with a wagering requirement, like any other bonus.
  7. If the cashback bonus has a wagering requirement, then it also has an expiration date by which you must use the bonus or it expires. A number of days when the bonus is valid is usually provided in bonus terms and conditions.
  8. Some bonuses require you to contact the support via live chat in order to activate them.
  9. Some casinos have been known to offer cashbacks if Bitcoin price drops while you have Bitcoin in your casino wallet, so that you do not lose value by playing, or sell the currency.

Bitcoin Casino Bonus Codes

As you have probably noticed, some bonuses require bonus codes in order to be activated. If they do not, it is enough to just click on the PLAY button, register on the Bitcoin gambling site, and claim the bonus.

I ALWAYS include Bitcoin bonus code in my bonus lists if you require one. But I gathered all the bonuses with codes here anyway.

Some bonuses with codes are higher if they are exclusive, so I included this information on the list as well. Here are the Bitcoin casino bonus codes:

Faucet bonuses are probably the rarest type of Bitcoin casino bonus, and there is a good reason for this.

Faucet bonuses come with no strings attached; no deposit requirements, no wagering requirements. They are quite literally free money, or a free Bitcoin bonus. Many casinos ceased to offer them because they were wildly abused, causing the casino to only lose money.

 

This is an example of how faucet bonuses look like on a lot of Blockchain casinos – they often come in the form of a wheel spin game.

Since a faucet bonus is completely free, the amounts of money that you receive for this bonus type are usually very low (typically a few ten or hundred Satoshis), but the good thing is that you can claim them quite frequently.

A Bitcoin faucet bonus is usually found in newer Blockchain casinos (I have not seen them elsewhere yet) and it is an excellent way to try out a casino before depositing your money there.

You can find many different kinds of faucets:

  • daily faucet bonuses in the form of a wheel spin, where you can win faucets in different currencies,
  • faucets that you get for signing up or confirming your e-mail,
  • ones you get for reloading your wallet if your balance comes to zero,
  • faucets for other things like logging in for a certain number of days in a row, for contributing to the casino’s forums/chats/Telegram groups, etc.
Test a faucet!

I added the Bitcoin casino faucet bonus to my casino bonus calculator just for fun, so that you can check your potential losses when playing various games.

Calculator

The highest paying Bitcoin faucets are around 300 Satoshi and are usually a part of a free wheel spin. You can find even higher faucet bonuses though; for example, BC.Game has a 1 BTC prize on their wheel spin game, but I honestly doubt that anyone will ever be able to get this amazing prize.

If you are looking to make money, Bitcoin faucets are not worth it. You get so little money that you would have to get extremely lucky to make enough cash out of it to be even eligible for a withdrawal. You have a much better chance with a good deposit bonus. See for yourself by trying out our casino bonus calculator.

How to Choose the Best Bonus for You?

There are 3 ways to approach this:

  1. You want a good welcome bonus but other great regular bonuses are also important to you.
  2. You want the best possible first deposit bonus or no deposit bonus to try out a new casino thoroughly. The other bonuses are an added value but not a priority to you.
  3. All you want is to win as much money as possible using the best Bitcoin casino bonus available.

Regardless of your choice, the wagering requirement along with clean bonus terms is what sets a good bonus apart from others. Either for the best no deposit or for the best deposit bonuses for Bitcoin.

Because many players are already aware of this, some casinos try to trick them into thinking that their bonus has good wagering conditions when the reality is quite the opposite. I laid all the details out for you in the next chapter, What to watch out for.

If you find yourself resonating the most with the first statement from the tree listed above, then you should be looking for a casino that has as many bonuses as possible, with an overall good wagering requirement.

If you resonate with the second statement, you want to consider a high bonus amount as well as a good wagering requirement.

And if you belong to the third group, then wagering requirement is basically your only priority.

This is why I included wagering requirement rating, bonus amount rating and all other bonuses by each casino in the Gamblineers bonus list, so check it out!

By the way – when you are looking for a Bitcoin casino bonus, it is always better to look among Bitcoin only casinos (or crypto only casinos). They always have much better offers that are especially tailored to the requirements of crypto users.

What to Watch Out for in Bitcoin Bonuses!

This is probably the most important thing I can tell you, and I wish that more gambling websites would talk about this.

There are 10 things I want to warn you about before you go on and use a bonus at any casino. The first item on the list is by far the most important one and is most often ‘concealed’ by casinos:

  • what wagering is on,
  • mandatory deposit for no deposit bonuses,
  • deposit money is used before bonus money,
  • maximum winnings,
  • different wagering for free spins,
  • min. deposit for bonus and free spins,
  • bonus validity,
  • you can’t play all games with bonuses,
  • wagering contribution of games,
  • restricted countries.

What Does the Wagering Requirement Apply To?

Every bonus has a wagering requirement which usually applies to the bonus amount. This means that you must wager the bonus money you receive x-number of times before you are allowed to withdraw it.

But this is not always the case.

The above example describes a bonus of 100 % up to 200 € with 17.5x wagering requirement. That sounds amazing! After all, a low wagering requirement means a better chance for you to get more money. Plus, low wagering requirement bonuses are tough to find.

A 17.5x wagering requirement means that you must wager your bonus 17.5 times, right?

Actually, no.

The wagering requirement above does not apply to the bonus amount as you are probably accustomed to, but to bonus + deposit amount!

This is the same as saying that you must wager your bonus 35 times, in the case of the above example with a 100 % match bonus. (Which is still a pretty good wagering requirement, by the way!)

Be extremely careful about what exactly the wagering refers to, so that you do not burn yourself after you have already deposited. This is why you will find that all wagering requirements listed here on Gamblineers also include what exactly the wagering refers to.

While some casinos tell you directly what their wagering requirements apply to in the bonus description section, others will require you to go digging around in their terms and conditions to find it somewhere in that fine print.

Mandatory Deposit for No Deposit Bonuses

Intuitively speaking, a no deposit bonus means that you do not have to make a deposit in order to get your bonus.

The reality is a bit different though.

So far, I have never come across a no deposit bonus where you did not have to deposit at least something. This usually happens before withdrawing any winnings that you might have made with the bonus.

And while more experienced players already know this, I am certain that a lot of players still are not aware of this and probably will not be until they experience the shock of finding it out by themselves.


So I think it is only fair that I point it out.

There might be different approaches to how casinos deal with these ‘no deposit deposits.’ Usually you are required to deposit either as much as you have won or some minimum deposit amount.

Now that you know this, do not get discouraged from using no deposit bonuses! The odds of winning money with a no deposit bonus are lower compared to other bonuses – but you risk less because you can always decide to not deposit anything and to not withdraw the free spins winnings!

Can you win from free spins??

  • Yes.

While you know what wagering for a regular match bonus means for you, free spins wagering isn’t that intuitive. After all, you don’t know how much bonus money you will end up with.

Before I begin, let me just say that the following calculation is not a guarantee but a theoretical estimate. That means that if a million players use the free spins, their averaged out bonus money and wins at the end should limit to the numbers below.

 

Let’s take the above no deposit free spins from BitStarz as our example.

You get 20 free spins with 40x wagering requirement and must deposit $20 to withdraw any winnings.

You can play the free spins on 3 different games and I’ll choose Aztec Magic because it has the highest RTP of the three (97 %). Each free spin has a total bet of $0.15.

So 20 spins of $0.15 where I get 97 % of my wagers returned to me in form of wins: 20 x 0.15 x 0.97 = 2.91

That means that players end up with around $2.91 on average after using their free spins. It’s not a lot, but it’s free money.

After that you have wagering requirement for this bonus money like for any other.

So in this case, the 20 free spins is like a 14.6 % match bonus with 40x wagering requirement on bonus and a minimum deposit of $20.

While that doesn’t sound very good, you can always decide not to deposit the $20 if you’re not satisfied with your free spins wins amount.

Deposit Money Is Used before Bonus Money

Not all, but a lot of casinos have this in their bonus terms.

When you make a deposit and receive some bonus money, you expect the wagering requirement to begin as soon as you start playing.

But in this case, you begin playing with your deposit, which usually only has a 1x wagering requirement. And only after you have wagered the deposit once does the wagering for the bonus begin.

For a 100 % match bonus with a 30x wagering requirement and 1x wagering requirement for the deposit, this would be the same as saying 31x wagering requirement for the bonus, which comes into effect as soon as you start playing.

Maximum Bonus Winnings

Some bonuses (free spins almost always and match deposit bonuses rarely) have a limit to how much money you can win.

This just means that if you win more than the maximum amount, the exceeding amount will be forfeited and you will get only the maximum amount.

Different Wagering Requirement for Bitcoin Casino Free Spins

With match bonuses that include free spins in Bitcoin casinos, the casino often writes down only the wagering requirement for the match bonus part in their promotion images since this represents the larger part of the bonus.


In this case, I do not think that this is done intentionally to trick or deceive you. It is difficult to include a lot of information in promotional banners, so casinos tend to only list the most important things.

But it is important to know that sometimes free spins can have a different wagering requirement than the rest of the bonus.

Different Minimum Deposit for Free Spins

Sometimes when welcome bonuses consist of both a match bonus and free spins, there is a different minimum deposit requirement to get one or the other. In such case, the minimum deposit for free spins is usually higher.

Bonus Expiry Date

Every bonus has a set validity, telling you how much time you have to use the bonus. Otherwise it expires.


Be careful – one bonus can contain many different validity dates:

  • General validity: How much time you have to wager your bonus.
  • Free spins validity: How fast you must use up any free spins.
  • Free spins requirement: In order to get free spins, you must sometimes wager your deposit or bonus at least once in the first 24 hours.

Not All Games Can Be Played with Bonuses

Besides the fact that you cannot play all games in all countries or territories, you also cannot play all games using a bonus.

Bitcoin casino free spins are always bound to a single or a few games, and usually these games all come from the same provider.

But even the match bonus has its limitations.


For example, there are 148 games mentioned in the image above.

Wagering Contribution of Games

wagering-contribution

When bonus terms tell you to wager the bonus x-number of times, you think of your favorite game and want use the bonus there. It may not be that simple.

The reason is that not all games fully contribute to the wagering requirement.

For example, a classic slot may contribute 100 %; every dollar you bet is also a dollar wagered for the bonus wagering requirement. But some games contribute only 50 % or 10 % or even 0 %. This means that for every dollar that you bet, only 0.5 USD or 0.1 USD or 0 USD count towards the bonus wagering requirement, respectively.

Casinos always list their games and how much they contribute in the bonus terms section. Usually, slots contribute 100 % (except progressive and jackpot slots). Table and live games always contribute less, but the exact percentage varies from casino to casino. Some casinos allow table games for bonus wagering; in such a case, they contribute a few percent. On the other hand, some casinos don not allow table and live games to contribute at all.

If your plan is to use a bonus in a specific game, especially in a table game, I suggest that you take a look at my Bitcoin roulette guide where I also listed table game contributions.

Restricted Countries for Bonuses

Even if your country doesn’t restrict you from signing up and playing in a casino, that doesn’t mean that the casino doesn’t restrict you from using a bonus if you come from a certain list of countries.


Casinos usually determine country restrictions for bonuses based on how many bonus abusers come from a certain country. If the percentage is high enough, the entire country gets restricted from using the bonus.

Some casinos do not restrict any countries, and some casinos have quite long lists. For example, the above list contains 78 countries.

FAQ

A Bitcoin bonus is an online Bitcoin casino’s promotion to attract new (or old) players by offering them additional money to play with.

Depending on the bonus type, you get the bonus either immediately or after making a deposit. A deposit bonus requires a deposit and a no deposit bonus does not require one. Next, you must wager the bonus as many times at that particular casino states in their terms and conditions; you wager it by playing games, and once the wagering requirement is fulfilled you are eligible for the withdrawal of your winnings. Some bonuses require a bonus code to be activated.

Some bonuses can be found on the casino’s website and some, usually more exclusive bonuses, can be found on sites like Gamblineers. You can get a no deposit bonus immediately by signing up at a casino, and a deposit bonus by making a deposit.

A deposit bonus is any bonus that requires you to make a deposit before you are able to claim that bonus. For example: first deposit bonus, second deposit bonus, reload bonus, etc. They are also called ‘match’ bonuses because the casino matches your deposit amount with their bonus money (how much exactly this ‘match’ is in percentage, varies).

A first deposit bonus is a bonus that you can only get when you make a first ever deposit at a casino. Usually, first deposit bonuses are the largest deposit bonuses that you can get.

A casino bonus can be withdrawn when you fulfill its wagering requirement. Every bonus must be wagered a certain number of times before it is eligible for withdrawal. Zero-wagering bonuses are the exception to the rule, but they are very rare and can usually only be obtained as a loyalty or VIP reward.

A no deposit bonus usually comes in the form of free spins and can be used in a slot game which is typically predetermined by the casino. Normally, you get the no deposit bonus at registration and free spins are applied as soon as you open the corresponding game.

When you get through your no deposit free spins, your winnings become your bonus money that has to be wagered according to the no deposit bonus wagering requirements. After the wagering requirement is fulfilled, the remaining money is yours to keep.

Currently, the best no deposit bonus would be FortuneJack‘s 50 free spins which you get at registration. They come with 0x wagering, but you must verify your email address and phone number to receive the free spins.

In my experience, all decent casinos give welcome bonuses. You can see the entire list here.

Casinos with the best bonuses have high bonuses, a large welcome package, frequent regular bonuses and low wagering requirements. You can find them listed here.

A no deposit bonus is the best option for new players who wish to test out a casino before they deposit their own money there. Once you have decided that you wish to make a deposit, a first deposit bonus is the best option. It usually comes with much better requirements and higher winnings than a no deposit bonus.

Wagering requirement tells you how many times you must wager your bonus (or deposit or both) before you are eligible for withdrawal of your winnings. 40x wagering of $100 of bonus money means that you must wager $100 × 40, which equals $4,000; in other words, you must make $4,000 worth of bets.

Conclusion

Let me finish this guide with a simple question: Should you use a casino bonus at all?

The answer depends on what kind of a person you are, so I will answer with another question:

Would you open a bank account at a bank that offers a discount on your account opening fees?

The answer to both questions should be the same.

May the odds be ever in your favor!
